abstract: Proteus Gowanus, which has served Brooklyn arts community as many things including gallery, museum and community center, will close after 10 years in former box factory near Gowanus Canal; founder Sasha Chavchavadze and director Tammy Pittman want to move on to other projects.
lead_paragraph: Proteus Gowanus will close on June 28 after 10 years of holding traditional and otherworldly art, whether that meant an anatomical art library or a museum dedicated to the Gowanus Canal Superfund site.

headline.main: An Ever-Changing Brooklyn Gallery Says Goodbye to Gowanus
headline.print_headline: An Ever-Changing Gallery Says Goodbye to Gowanus

snippet: Proteus Gowanus will close on June 28 after 10 years of holding traditional and otherworldly art, whether that meant an anatomical art library or a museum dedicated to the Gowanus Canal Superfund site.
